memory_verse.label: Memory Verse
memory_verse.text: “Her children arise and call her blessed; her husband also, and he praises her.” – Proverbs 31:28

devotion.label: Insight / Reflection
devotion.text:
Mothers are always special. They play a divine role in shaping the world. Behind every success, there is often a mother’s unseen hand. It is no exaggeration it’s the truth written in every life story. We call our land Motherland, our language Mother Tongue, and even the main system of a computer Motherboard! This shows how deeply the word mother signifies origin, care, and connection.

Even the Lord compares His love to a mother’s love: “Can a mother forget her nursing child?” (Isaiah 49:15). The apostle Paul also reveals that our heavenly city, Jerusalem above, is the mother of us all. Mothers embody patience, sacrifice, and compassion. They deserve honor and affection, not neglect and loneliness.

Sadly, in our modern world, many aged mothers are forgotten left to bear their burdens alone. But God’s Word declares such behavior detestable. From the cross, Jesus entrusted His mother to John’s care  showing us the divine importance of honoring our mothers even in our most painful moments.

Mothers are the lighthouses of families. Their tears water our growth; their prayers guard our paths. Let us love them, care for them, and return the gratitude they once poured upon us. A mother’s heart is the closest reflection of God’s heart on earth.

quote.label: Today's Quote
quote.text: “A mother’s arms are made of tenderness, and children sleep soundly in them.” – Victor Hugo

prayer.label: Prayer
prayer.text: Loving Father, thank You for the gift of mothers. Help us to cherish, honor, and comfort them as You comfort us. Let their days be filled with peace and respect. Amen.

conclusion.label: A Word to You
text: May the Lord bless every mother with strength and joy.
May her legacy shine bright through generations to come.

recommended_book.title: “The Power of a Praying parent”
recommended_book.author: Stormie Omartian
recommended_book.quote: “A mother’s prayer can reach where her hands cannot.”
